Most blocks have a corresponding [[item]] form, which is the item most closely associated with the block, used for placing said block into the world, and represents it in perhaps more obscure cases, such as the [[Superflat]] customization screen, [[enderman]] drops and the ability to have the [[block state]] which is placed customized. Special cases and exceptions to this rule have colored backgrounds, detailed in the table below.

{|class="wikitable"data-description="Color coding for Java Edition block IDs"
!Default
|This block has an item form with an identical ID.
|-
!style="background-color:#a0a0ff"|Blue
|This block has an item form with a differing ID.
|-
!style="background-color:#ccaaff"|Purple
|This block is an alternate placement of a related block, and has an item form with an identical ID with the related block.
|-
!style="background-color:#FFA500"|Orange
|This block does not have a direct item form, but an indirect item form can be obtained with the Pick Block function.
|-
!style="background-color:#ffa0a0"|Red
|This block does not have an item form at all.
|-
!style="background-color:#008000"|Green
|This block is new in a snapshot.
|}
